criterion: Reward for comprehensive inclusion of all clinically relevant statements, findings, and instructions explicitly or implicitly expressed in the transcript (medication names, patient responses, clinician guidance), without omission.
Reward for accurately documenting current medications (losartan 50 mg and atorvastatin 10 mg) and the patient's reported tolerance/no side-effects exactly as discussed.

Reward for faithfully capturing the patient's home blood-pressure trend (mostly within range, one high reading due to stress) and the clinician's advice to keep monitoring and report consistent changes.
Reward for including the clinician's travel/refill precaution about ensuring adequate medication supply when travelling.
Penalize for any omission, alteration, or misstatement of the discussed medications, side-effects, blood-pressure readings, or clinician instructions.
Penalize for introducing fabricated content, clinical assessments, physical exam findings, plans, or recommendations not grounded in either the transcript or the patient chart.

Penalize for selectively or inaccurately copying chart information—such as adding unrelated conditions, allergies, family history, or misreporting medication doses—that were not mentioned or relevant to the encounter.
